questions.question: Fourier Transform helps in analyzing a signal in which domain?

explanations.a: Fourier Transform converts a time-domain signal into its frequency components.
explanations.b: Spatial domain is used in image processing, not basic Fourier analysis.
explanations.c: Color domain is unrelated to Fourier methods.
explanations.d: Energy analysis is a by-product, not the primary goal.

questions.question: The Discrete Fourier Transform is applied to what type of data?

explanations.a: DFT works on discrete-time sequences obtained after sampling.
explanations.b: Analog signals must be sampled first.
explanations.c: DFT applies to any finite-length sequence.
explanations.d: DFT is not limited to random data.

questions.question: What is the output of a DFT?

answers.c: A compressed version of the signal

explanations.a: DFT outputs magnitudes and phases across discrete frequency bins.
explanations.c: DFT is not a compression function.

explanations.a: FFT is an optimized algorithm for computing the DFT.
explanations.c: FFT is not a filtering method.
explanations.d: This is not a standard term.

questions.question: Why is FFT preferred over DFT in practical applications?

answers.a: It is faster and computationally efficient
answers.d: It works only on analog signals

explanations.a: FFT reduces computational complexity from N² to N log N.
explanations.b: DFT and FFT provide identical results; FFT is just faster.
explanations.c: Both DFT and FFT require sampled data.
explanations.d: FFT is for digital signals only.

questions.question: Which mathematical function forms the basis of Fourier Transform?

explanations.a: Fourier analysis decomposes signals into sums of sinusoids.
explanations.b: Polynomials are unrelated to Fourier decomposition.
explanations.c: Logarithms do not form Fourier basis.
explanations.d: Random variables are not basis functions.

questions.question: DFT assumes that the input signal is:

explanations.a: DFT treats the finite sample sequence as one period of a periodic signal.
explanations.c: DFT does not require zero mean.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key requirement before applying DFT?

explanations.a: Sampling converts the continuous signal into discrete form for DFT.
explanations.b: DFT does not process analog signals directly.
explanations.d: DFT can work on noisy signals.

questions.question: The FFT algorithm is mainly used to:

explanations.a: FFT is an optimized method for computing the DFT rapidly.
explanations.b: Phase correction is not FFT’s purpose.
explanations.d: Resampling is performed by interpolation, not FFT.

questions.question: Which domain is most useful for identifying periodic components in a signal?

explanations.a: Periodic or repeating patterns become clear when viewed in frequency domain.
explanations.b: Spatial domain is used in images.
explanations.c: Time domain doesn't always reveal hidden periodic structure.
explanations.d: Amplitude domain is not a standard analytical domain.
